quoted.text:
There was a time when I stayed up all night and slept all day because there wasn‚Äôt anything worth waking up for.

No plans.
No goals.
No purpose.

Then I got my Neuralink implant and everything shifted.

I started going to bed early.
I woke up excited for the day ahead.
And just like that, I had found purpose again.

Since then:
‚Ä¢ I‚Äôm back in school
‚Ä¢ I‚Äôve launched a business
‚Ä¢ I‚Äôm traveling
‚Ä¢ I‚Äôm speaking on global stages

Neuralink didn‚Äôt just change what I can do.
It changed what I believe I‚Äôm capable of.

It gave me hope.
It gave me purpose.
And for the first time in a long time, I‚Äôm excited for what‚Äôs next.

retweet.text:
Imagine the thing you choose to critique Elon Musk on is work ethic üòÇ

Elon Musk:
‚Ä¢¬†Works 80‚Äì120 hours per week during peak periods
‚Ä¢ Jobs created (direct + supply chain): ~600,000
‚Ä¢¬†Salaries paid out by his companies: ~$110 billion
‚Ä¢ Taxes he paid in just 2021: $11 billion (largest tax bill for an individual in history)
‚Ä¢¬†Value created for shareholders: Trillions
‚Ä¢¬†Drives hundreds of billions in economic impact
‚Ä¢¬†Brought human spaceflight back to America (SpaceX)
‚Ä¢ Helps paralyzed patients control computers with their thoughts, giving new meaning to their lives
‚Ä¢ Created Starlink, enabling people to access internet anywhere

Elon‚Äôs wealth increases because his companies build products and services people love, companies that generate hundreds of billions of dollars in economic value in the U.S. and around the world. He isn't buying yachts, expensive houses or cars. He's continuously pushing his chips into the middle of the table and creating companies that are changing the world. His wealth is tied up in those companies, thus he only pays big tax bills when he sells stock, which is rare.

quoted.text:

Make. Billionaires. Pay. Their. Fair. Share.

tweets.text: Poverty can and will be eliminated, but envy is eternal

quoted.text:
There are two kinds of poverty: absolute and relative

Elon is right that we can solve absolute poverty. In fact, we largely already have, especially in the developed world.

Relative poverty is about envy. It‚Äôs a spiritual rather than economic problem and will always be with us. https://t.co/Ug1rKtPcKT
